author: ivan
msg: Follow-up to r1682: Fix Windows build.

author: lgo
msg: Similar to r1678, raise an error when the body of a chunk-encoded HTTP response
is smaller than what we expect from the chunk size.
This avoids the application - which now gets APR_EOF - to think the response
(serf_dechunk_read): Return error when APR_EOF is received from the stream
and the current chunk hasn't been read completely.
(test_response_body_too_small_cl): comment fix to clarify that this test
relates to response bodies with Content-Length.

author: lgo
msg: Follow up to r1678: use apr_int64_t for total length of response body.
(struct response_context_t): Use apr_int64_t for exp_body_len and
actual_body_len so that we can correctly handle response bodies with lengths

author: lgo
msg: Add an internal API to response_bucket that will allows serf to look at the
status code and headers of a response without consuming this data, so that
it can be read back later in an application-specific bucket.
and morph the response bucket in an aggregate bucket wrapping status line,
(test_header_buckets): New test for existing but yet untested functionality.
test_response_bucket_peek_at_headers): New test for the new internal API.
(test_buckets): Add the new tests, reorder a bit.
